strTitle: Trigger for the Whodunnit Plot Start Beat
strDesc: [us] is ready to start a Whodunnit plot.

strTitle: Trigger for the Whodunnit Plot VictimFound Beat
strDesc: [us] has found [them]'s murdered body in the Whodunnit plot.

strTitle: Trigger for the Whodunnit Plot BodyFound Beat

strTitle: Trigger for the Whodunnit Plot CasefileFound Beat

strTitle: Trigger for the Whodunnit Close Case Beat
strDesc: [us] ends a Whodunnit arc.

strTitle: Trigger for the Whodunnit Death Close Case Beat
strDesc: [us] ends a Whodunnit arc.
[us] closely examines the body to get a better idea of what happened. Washing up after such grisly work is recommended.
[us] does not get dirty.
[us] gets dirty.
Reveals [them]'s basics.
[them] is a kid.
This male corpse was a kid once called [them], but is now definitely dead.
This female corpse was a kid once called [them], but is now definitely dead.
This non-binary corpse was a kid once called [them], but is now definitely dead.
[them] is a young adult.
This young adult male corpse was known as [them], but is now definitely dead.
This young adult female corpse was known as [them], but is now definitely dead.
This young adult non-binary corpse was known as [them], but is now definitely dead.
[them] is middle aged.
This middle aged male corpse was known as [them], but is now definitely dead.
This middle aged female corpse was known as [them], but is now definitely dead.
This middle aged non-binary corpse was known as [them], but is now definitely dead.
[them] is elderly.
This elderly male corpse was known as [them], but is now definitely dead.
This elderly female corpse was known as [them], but is now definitely dead.
This elderly non-binary corpse was known as [them], but is now definitely dead.
[them] is exceptionally elderly.
This exceptionally elderly male corpse was known as [them], but is now definitely dead. They made it so far!
This exceptionally elderly female corpse was known as [them], but is now definitely dead. They made it so far!
This exceptionally elderly non-binary corpse was known as [them], but is now definitely dead. They made it so far!
Reveals one of [them]'s fatal conditions.
[them] has no apparent cause of death, but their skin is necrotized and blackened in the shape of a hand with overly long fingers. This death appears clearly unnatural.
[them] suffered acute bleeding in the lungs.
It appears most likely [them] suffered their injuries from a collision, accident, or hypervelocity debris.
It appears [them] died due to violence or foul play.
[them] suffered severe brain trauma.
[them] was fatally poisoned. This does not happen by accident.
[them] suffered fatal blood loss.
It appears most likely [them] suffered their injuries from an accident, collision, or self-infliction.
It appears [them] died due to violence or foul play.
[them] suffered fatal cardiac arrest.
[them] died of alcohol poisoning.
[them] froze to death.
[them] suffered organ failure due to heat stroke.
[them] suffered asphyxiation due to hypercapnia.
[them] suffered asphyxiation due to hypoxia.
[them] died of thirst.
[them] died from starvation.
[them] suffered fatal septicemia.
[them] is certainly dead, but shows little sign of a cause.
[us] decides to investigate [them]'s suspicious death and readies a casefile for collecting notes and clues. A well-documented case file could fetch a reward with local authorities.
strTooltip: Commit to investigate this soul's demise. Perhaps with enough clues you could even bring justice, or at least a cash bounty with the local authorities.

strDesc: [us] decides to report [them]'s death and readies a casefile for collecting notes about the incident.
strTooltip: Commit to report this soul's death. Carry the casefile to gain related interaciton options, including abandoning this commitment.

strDesc: [us] looks on and around [them]'s body for clues that may reveal something about the killer.
strTooltip:
Search for clues on and around the body that may reveal information about a possible killer.
It's dirty, disheartening work, but you may be helping someone.

[us] collects some of the blood on and around [them]. It may not be all theirs. Van Buren kiosks or high-tech medical beds could probably analyze this. The kiosk will charge a fee.
strTooltip:
Collect some blood from on and around the body for forensic analysis.
You will need a waterproof container to carry it.

strDesc: [us] pays [them] and hands over the blood for a rapid blood lab analysis.
strTooltip:
Analyzes blood for a fee.
Consumes analyzed blood.
Cost: $1,750

strDesc: [them]'s lab results indicate this blood matches the profile of [3rd].
[us] can't afford $1,750 blood analysis services from [them].
[us] uses [them] together with their medical diagnostics skills to process a rapid blood lab analysis.
strTooltip:
Analyzes blood using your own Medical Diagnostics skills for free.
Consumes analyzed blood and requires extended uninterrupted time.

strDesc: [us]'s lab results indicate this blood matches the profile of [3rd].
[us] is unable to complete a blood analysis using [them].
[us] collects some hair and skin from both on and around [them]. It may not be all theirs. Van Buren kiosks or high-tech medical beds could probably analyze this. The kiosk will charge a fee.
strTooltip:
Collect some DNA smples from on and around the body for forensic analysis.
It's unpleasant and disheartening work.

strDesc: [us] pays [them] and hands over the sample material for a rapid DNA lab analysis.
strTooltip:
Analyzes DNA for a fee in hopes of identifying a matching person from available database profiles.
Consumes analyzed DNA.
Cost: $4,000

strDesc: [them]'s lab results indicate this DNA matches the profile of [3rd].
[us] can't afford $4,000 DNA analysis services from [them].

Consumes analyzed DNA and requires extended uninterrupted time.

strDesc: [us]'s lab results indicate this DNA matches the profile of [3rd].
[us] is unable to complete a DNA analysis using [them].
[us] examines [them]'s body and surroundings for clues about close relations or enemies. It's not pleasant work.
strTooltip:
Attempt to determine who might want to know about this death.
Not for the faint of heart.

strDesc: [us] finds signs that [3rd] is a relative or friend that may want to know about [them]'s death.
[us] finds signs that [3rd] was an enemy of [them] and may appreciate hearing about [them]'s death.
[us] finds no signs of [them]'s relatives or friends. Perhaps local authorities or other groups would appreciate the report.
[us] reports to [them] what they found and learned about [3rd]'s death.
[us] grieves, eventually offering [them] a token of gratitude for taking the time and effort to help [3rd] find rest and dignity in death.
[them] pays [us].
[us] still sees [them] as an enemy.
[us] sees [them] as a friend for telling them about [3rd]'s death.
[us] reports to [them] the juicy details of [3rd]'s death.
[us] sees [them] as an enemy.
[us] sees [them] as a friend for telling them about [3rd]'s death.
[us] exults at [them]'s news that [3rd] found their death. They want to share a drink and a pack of Damask Rose with them.
[them] pays [us].
[them] offers [us] drink and smoke.
[us] joins [them] in a toast celebrating [3rd]'s death.
[us] joins [them] in sharing an intoxicating Damask Rose or two celebrating [3rd]'s death.
[us] examines [them]'s body and surroundings for clues about faction affiliations. It's not pleasant work.
strTooltip:
Attempt to determine who might want to know about this soul's demise.
Not for the faint of heart.

strDesc: Reveals what factions may want to  know of [them]'s demise.

[them] is a shipbreaker, the most common soul around the Boneyard. Informing a friend or next of kin would be kind, but informing AyoSec or telling an Ayotimiwa Corp manager of their lost asset could earn favor or a reward.
[them] is a criminal. Informing either someone influential in the underworld or an AyoSec officer is likely to earn favor or rewards with the respective faction.

[them] is an outlaw respected by few, but whose death would be celebrated by many. If you find someone who considers them an enemy, you could make a friend. Otherwise, local security personnel are always fond of touting another threat no longer menacing their jurisdiction.
[them] is a contractor working for the private military company AyoSec. Informing either an Ayotimiwa Corp manager or another AyoSec officer may earn favor or rewards.
[them] is an Ayotimiwa Corp employee. Informing AyoSec or an Ayotimiwa Corp manager may earn favor or a reward.
[them] is a bartender, which means they were likely well known and well-connected. Informing another bartender or an AyoSec officer may earn favor or rewards.
[them]'s affiliations or livelihood are unclear.
[us] presents clues implicating [them] as responsible for [3rd]'s death.
[us] has too few clues to achieve a confession from [3rd]'s killer.
[us] tells [them] those clues hardly imply their guilt. They double-down on claiming a solid alibi, and nobody will believe [them]'s wild accusations.
[us] has enough clues to achieve a confession from [3rd]'s killer.
[us] admits to killing [3rd], and seems remorseful. They claim it was an accident.
[us] confesses to killing [3rd], and seems remorseful. They made a mistake in a moment of emotion.
[us] confesses to killing [3rd], but claims it was a matter of self-defense. They ask if [them] has never been in a similar life-or-death situation.
[us] confesses to killing [3rd], but claims the act was vengeance for terrible harm [3rd] inflicted on them.
[us] confesses to killing [3rd], then describes how the act achieved justice for the wrongs [3rd] inflicted on many others, and would continue doing so.
[us] reminds [them] that they work for the local authorities, with a lot of powerful allies. There won't likely be consequences for [3rd]'s death. That's not how this works.
[us] asks [them] if they realize who they're talking to, then warns [them] to watch their step. Who would believe wild claims over the word of someone in their respected position?
[us] has something else going on when accusing [them] of being [3rd]'s killer.
[us] says to back off. They claim to not know what [them] is talking about, and they're not interested in any trouble.
[us] asks [them] what the may know about [3rd]'s suspicious death.
[us] doesn't know anything. They don't even know who [3rd] is.
[us] might remember something recently that could connect [3rd] to a killer.
[us] doesn't know anything. They don't even know who [3rd] is.
[us] knows [3rd] fondly and asks for more info on what happened. They may have clues to share if pressed.
[us] presses [them] for any clues they may have about suspects or motive in [3rd]'s death.
[us] hates [3rd] and delights in news of their death. "Good riddance!" sums up their sentiment.
[us] talks about some recent memories about [3rd] that may be relevant.
[us] doesn't want any trouble.
[us] reports to [them] what they have discovered about [3rd]'s suspicious death.
[us] already made their final case to the authorities about [3rd]'s death. Unless there's a family to tell, it's over.
[us] shares their notes with minimal leads pointing toward [3rd]'s killer.
[us] tells [them] they'll need more leads if they want this case to go anywhere. "Come back when you have more." By this evidence, [3rd]'s killer could be practically anyone or anywhere.
[us] shares their investigation notes including [3rd] confession to murder.
[us] shows that they are impressed with [them]'s thorough investigation into [3rd]'s crime. They'll mention this to AyoSec and look for future work.
[them] pays [us].
[us] shares their investigation notes narrowing down [3rd]'s killer.
[us] thanks [them] for the report about [3rd]'s murder, then voices admiration for their stones reporting to [us]. They insist they'll move it right along.
[us] takes an interest in [them]'s collected leads regarding [3rd]'s murder and killer. "Do you want me to process this, or do you think there could be more?"
[us] thinks they can find more leads for this case in the pursuit of justice.
[us] finalizes their case. They don't plan on collecting any more clues about [3rd]'s killing.

[us] takes notes about [3rd]'s unfortunate killing from the testimony of [them], transferring them a payment for their effort.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] is visibly agitated by the reported murder of [3rd]. They stare at [them] a long time, then salute the fallen officer, and finalize their report. They transfer a payment for [them]'s effort.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] is deferential and stone-cold professional receiving [them]'s report about the murder of [3rd]. This is serious business. They transfer the company-funded reward for information.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] is pleased [3rd] is gone and pays [them] a bounty.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] exults that [3rd] is no longer a threat, happily paying [them] their outstanding bounty.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] tells fond stories about [3rd], shaking their head about the senseless murder. They transfer a payment for [them]'s effort.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] takes little interest in [3rd]'s death, but transfers a civil incentive payment for [them]'s effort.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

strTitle: Report Case as Just a Death
strDesc: [us] reports to [them] what they have discovered about [3rd]'s death.
strTooltip: [us] reports to [them] that they discovered [3rd]'s body, but they cannot demonstrate foul play with the minimal leads collected.

strDesc: [us] reports to [them] what they discovered about [3rd]'s death.
[us] reports to [them] what they discovered about [3rd]'s death.
[us] conveys that they already heard about [3rd]'s death.
[us] takes minimalist notes about [3rd]'s unfortunate death from the testimony of [them], eyeing them suspiciously.

[us] takes minimalist notes about [3rd]'s unfortunate death from the testimony of [them], eyeing them suspiciously. Nevertheless, they transfer a payment for [them]'s effort.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] is visibly agitated by the reported death of [3rd]. They stare at [them] a long time, then salute the fallen officer, and take their report. They transfer a payment for [them]'s effort.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] is deferential and stone-cold professional receiving [them]'s report about the death of [3rd]. They transfer the reward for information.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] is pleased [3rd] is gone and pays [them] a bounty.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] exults that [3rd] is no longer a threat, happily paying [them] their bounty.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] tells stories about [3rd], shaking their head about the senseless loss. They transfer a payment for [them]'s effort.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].
[us] takes little interest in [3rd]'s death.
[us] thanks [them] for the information about [3rd]. They begin filing the necessary paperwork.

[us] fusses about wasted human capital, reluctantly files a prefunctory stipend for [them], then gets over it pretty quickly.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] grouses about the shame of lost talent, but musters composure and transfers a stipend [them]'s way.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] grieves the loss of a coworker, but may relish the opportunity for restructuring. They transfer a stipend [them]'s way.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].
[us] has no interest in [3rd]'s death.
[us] thanks [them] for the intel about [3rd] rather than providing it to AyoSec. They begin talking about cleaning up and filling the gap in operations.

Masked in the subtleties of street slang, [us] crows about the death of [3rd]. They push for gory details, clearly eager to pass the word, then gift [them] a stiff drink and a cash transfer.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] mutters about all corpo mercs being bastards, then thanks [them] for the news about [3rd]. They transfer a payment for [them]'s effort.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].
[us] rattles about bringing down the corporate elites, but words are all they've got to offer.

Using the elaborate gestures and rituals of underworld spacers [us] mourns the loss of [3rd], embracing [them] for bringing the news. They shake hands transferring a weapon, suggesting [them] may want to either fill the gap, or avenge the loss. They also transfer a payment for [them]'s loyalty.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].

[us] thanks [them] for the information about [3rd]. They begin discussing cleaning up loose ends and filling the gap. They transfer a payment for [them]'s loyalty.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].
[us] has little interest in [3rd]'s death. Just another corpse for the void.
[us] thanks [them] for the tragic news about [3rd]. They start telling stories about them to anyone who will listen.

[us] grieves at the news of the death of [3rd]. They were remarkable, apparently, and will by missed by many. [us] thanks [them] with a free bottle for the tragic news, then starts telling stories about [3rd] to anyone who will listen. They transfer a payment for [them]'s effort.
Close the investigation via the case file.
[them] pays [us].
[us] is sad for [3rd]'s death, they really are.
[them] should show [us] the casefile with information about [3rd].
[us] is not responsible for the dead. Factional authorities may have more interest.
[us] concludes their casefile on [3rd]. Clearing the way for an upcoming investigation.
[them] removes their casefile on [3rd].
